definition: to pay attention to/to care about/to attach importance to
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Li (surname)
lining/interior/inside/internal/also written 裏|里[li3]
variant of 裡|里[li3]

sentences.english: She won't pay any more attention to us if she becomes a manager-assistant.
sentences.chinese: 如果她当上经理助理就会把我们不放在眼里。

sentences.english: Golden webbed hands say he wings hard now, do not put yourself in the eyes.
sentences.chinese: 金童便说他现在翅膀硬了，不把自己放在眼里了。

sentences.english: The prince dont in the eyes, there and then want to search in the fall.
sentences.chinese: 太子不把如意放在眼里，当场就想搜索晋王下落。

sentences.english: She thinks nothing of a difficulty like that.
sentences.chinese: 这点困难她根本不放在眼里。

definition: to take seriously (often with negative expression: "don't take it too seriously")/to treat conscientiously

to offend

arrogant and conceited

to look down upon/to despise

egotistical/arrogant/brassy
